chunk_id: Integrated Maternal and Perinatal Care Guideline_23_10_2024_0__chunk_736
source: Integrated Maternal and Perinatal Care Guideline_23_10_2024_0
text:
urgently to a specialist hospital unless
delivery is imminent.
On arrival at specialist hospital, manage as follows: 
• Aim to deliver vaginally within eight hours.
o Rupture membranes if not done yet, as soon as possible, even if the cervix is unfavourable
• Take blood for cross-match, FBC, INR, PTT, and urea and creatinine.
o Can also do whole blood clotting time in glass tube; it should be less than 7 minutes.
• Blood transfusion (two to four units) is usually necessary, with two units of Fr
